intro: Hermannia mollis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as coffee and gardenias. Hermannia mollis thrives in humid, shady environments and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It produces small, yellow fruits that contain seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
